knimeNode.name: Date&Time Shift
knimeNode.shortDescription: Shifts a date or time according to a period, duration or granularity.

fullDescription.intro: The node shifts a date or time with a defined period, duration or granularity. The user can select the Date&Time columns to shift and the shift value. The shift value can be achieved by using either a period/duration column or a numerical column, however, it is also possible to enter a constant shift value (either period/duration or numerical combined with a granularity). If the shift value is positive, it is added to the selected date. A negative value will be subtracted. A numerical value is interpreted based on the selected granularity (year, month, week, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond, nanosecond).

tab.name: Column Selection
tab.option:
Only the included columns will be shifted.
Note: A LocalTime can not be shifted by years, months or weeks. A LocalDate can not be shifted by hours, minutes or seconds.

tab.name: Replace/Append Selection
tab.option: The selected columns will be appended to the input table. The suffix of the appended columns can be provided in the text field to the right.
The selected columns will be replaced by the new columns.

tab.name: Use Period/Duration
tab.option: Select to choose the shift value from a period or duration column.

Select to insert a format string (defined by either the ISO-8601 representation (see period format or duration format for details), the short letter representation (e.g. '2y 3M 1d'; Period: y: years, M: months, d: days; Duration: H: hours, m: minutes, s: seconds) or the long word representation (e.g. '2 years 3 months 1 day') to use as constant shift value.
Examples for ISO-8601 (Period):
"P2Y" parses as "+2 years"
"P-2Y" parses as "-2 years"
"P1Y2M3W4D" parses as "1 year, 2 months, 3 weeks and 4 days"
Examples for ISO-8601 (Duration):
"PT15M" parses as "+15 minutes"
"-PT15M" parses as "-15 minutes"
"PT2H15M3.5S" parses as "2 hours, 15 minutes and 3.5 seconds"

tab.name: Use Numerical
tab.option: Select to choose the shift value from a numerical column. A positive value will be added to the reference date or time, a negative one subtracted from it.
Select to insert an integer to use as constant shift value. A positive value will be added to the reference date or time, a negative one subtracted from it.
The granularity of the numerical value (in years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds, nanoseconds).
